titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees, Local 52 Records WAG.251
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-08-25T11:17-0400

change.item: Edited by Maggie Schreiner to reflect updated administrative information

did.unittitle: International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees, Local 52 Records

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees and Moving Picture Machine Operators of the United States and Canada. Local 52 (New York, N.Y.).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: IATSE, Local 52 (Motion Picture and Sound Mechanics) records include membership directory, Local 52 newsletters, 50th anniversary program, Executive Board minutes (1966-1990), budget meeting minutes, general membership meeting minutes, and by-laws.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: In 2014, the archived website was added as a series.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees, Local 52; WAG 251; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by the International Alliance of Theatrical and Stage Employees, Local 52 are held by Local 52. Permission to publish or reproduce materials to which the Local holds copyright must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Tamiment Library for assistance with contacting Local 52.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The International Alliance of Theatrical and Stage Employees, Local 52 was founded in the early 1920s, and officially chartered by the International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees (IATSE) in 1924.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Materials found in repository; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1987.006.

controlaccess.subject: Theaters |x Employees |X Labor unions |z United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: International Alliance of Theatrical and Stage Employees, Local 52 was founded in the early 1920s, and was officially chartered by the International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employees (IATSE) in 1924. The localâ€™s jurisdiction includes, New York, New Jersey, Delaware, Pennsylvania (with the exception of Pittsburgh), and Connecticut. The labor union represents technicians, artisans and craftspeople in the entertainment industry, including live theatre, motion picture and television production, and trade shows. The website includes information on films and television series currently being filmed in the local's jurisdiction, membership applications, links and other resources.
